Recipe For Diabetic Dog Treats

If you have a furry friend who has been diagnosed with diabetes, you know how important it is to provide them with a balanced and healthy diet. Just like humans, dogs with diabetes require special care when it comes to their food. One way to ensure they are getting the right nutrients is by making homemade diabetic dog treats. Here is a simple recipe that your pup is sure to love!

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup whole wheat flour
  • 1/4 cup ground flaxseed
  • 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
  • 1/4 cup water
  • 1/4 cup grated carrots
  • 1/4 cup chopped green beans
  • 1/4 cup chopped cooked chicken (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, combine the whole wheat flour and ground flaxseed.
  3. Add the applesauce and water to the dry ingredients and mix well.
  4. Fold in the grated carrots, chopped green beans, and cooked chicken (if using).
  5. Knead the dough until it forms a ball. If the dough is too dry, add a little more water. If it's too sticky, add a little more flour.
  6. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to about 1/4 inch thickness.
  7. Use cookie cutters to cut out shapes or simply use a knife to cut the dough into small squares.
  8. Place the treats on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
  9. Allow the treats to cool completely before serving them to your diabetic dog.

These homemade diabetic dog treats are not only delicious but also packed with nutrients that are beneficial for your pup's health. Remember to consult with your veterinarian before making any changes to your dog's diet, especially if they have diabetes.
